availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Thomas Steele (Woodford County, KY, farmer, soldier, prov govt)

body.p: Woodford County, Kentucky, farmer, soldier, and member of the provisional government of Kentucky. Alabama native. Son of William J. Steele and Mary Steele. Farmer in Woodford County in 1860. Member of the convention of the provisional government held at Russellville in November 1861. Served in the 4th Kentucky Mounted Infantry (C.S.A.) as a lieutenant and captain from August 24, 1861 to 1865. Captured at the Battle of Shiloh on April 7, 1862. Prisoner of war at Johnson's Island from July 3, 1862 to September 1, 1862. Captured at Mt. Sterling, Kentucky on April 2, 1865.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Woodford County, p. 944.
